Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery jar, the fabric is relatively coarse, grey in section and contains a large number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and very faint traces of one line of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393477) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393477)
